title: The Verge Tracking
body:
## Description

Provide compatibilty for Verkle-enabled execution clients by receiving and propagating the `ExecutionWitness` inside the `ExecutionPayload`.
Current working branch is at https://github.com/macladson/lighthouse/tree/verkle-trees-full (will move to a `/sigp` branch later)

## Useful Links

- Draft spec: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3230
- Lighthouse PR: https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/pull/3923

## Major Tasks
- [x] Implement the `ExecutionWitness` type.
- [ ] Implement Optionals in SSZ and replace the instances of `Union[None, T]`.
- [ ] Rebase on Capella and Deneb.
- [ ] Add fork implementation.
- [ ] Other unrelated fork additions?

## Outstanding Questions

In the `ExecutionWitness`, the `suffix` field inside each `StateSuffixDiff` is defined as a `uint8`. Does this value need to be quoted for consistency with other integer types? Does it also need to be serialized into big-endian hex?

Will there be any other additions into this fork beyond supporting Verkle Trees?

## Current Testnets

### Beverly Hills

Running unchanged Consensus (all) with Verkle-enabled Execution (Geth-only)
[Testnet link](https://beverlyhills.ethpandaops.io/)

### Kaustinen
Running Verkle-enabled Consensus (Lighthouse-only) with Verkle-enabled Execution (Geth-only)
[Testnet link](https://kaustinen.ethpandaops.io/)

Currently running the full spec with the following changes:
 - `new_value` is omitted from the `SuffixStateDiff` container.
 - `ExecutionWitness` is added directly to the Bellatrix `ExecutionPayload` without any fork implementation.
 - Is currently using `Union[None, T]` for optionals.
